private_information: I can generate a detailed, ordered sequence of disk moves using human-readable notation (for example: move A from middle to left).
I know the standard recursive solution pattern for Tower of Hanoi puzzles and can expand it into an explicit move list.
operator.goal: Produce a concrete step-by-step move plan that moves all 7 disks from the middle peg to the left peg following the rules.

private_information: I can produce a precise formal specification of predicates, constants, types, and action schemas (preconditions and effects) for planning domains.
I understand how to encode the Tower of Hanoi state using predicates like on, clear, on-table, and size relations.
modeler.goal: Provide a structured formal model specification for the 7-disk Tower of Hanoi instance that the orchestrator can convert into PDDL.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency, and I remove bookkeeping shortcuts or implicit assumptions (such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties).
I validate that every move is legal with respect to the formal model and that no step relies on an unmodeled shortcut.
auditor.goal: Check the proposed plan and model for causal and temporal correctness, flag or correct any illegal moves, and produce an audit report that removes bookkeeping shortcuts.

private_information: I will integrate model specifications, operator plans, and auditor reports into a single, consistent PDDL domain and problem.
I will produce PDDL formatted for the FastDownward solver and keep the agents' actions distinct in the integrated specification.
orchestrator.goal: Assemble and finalize a complete PDDL domain and problem for the 7-disk Tower of Hanoi that can be solved by FastDownward, ensuring all constraints and agent distinctions are preserved.

public_information: There are 7 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, disk E, disk F, and disk G.
There are three pegs: left, middle, and right.
Initial condition: the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, disk E, disk F, and disk G. The left peg and the right peg are empty.
Goal condition: the left peg must hold, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, disk E, disk F, and disk G, and both the middle peg and the right peg must be empty.
Allowed action: move the top disk from one peg to another peg.

Rules: only one disk may be moved at a time; you may only move a disk that is on top of a peg; you may never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk; once a disk is moved, its relative size ordering with the others remains.
The right peg may be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

plan.system_prompt: You are the operator agent responsible for producing an explicit, ordered sequence of moves for the Tower of Hanoi instance. Do not emit PDDL. Provide the plan as a clear ordered list of moves using the notation: move <disk> from <source-peg> to <destination-peg>.
plan.prompt: Your name is operator. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->operator->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->operator->goal} Think step by step and generate a complete, explicit move sequence that achieves the goal without making unverified assumptions. If information is missing, produce the plan only for the part you can justify.

spec.system_prompt: You are the modeler agent. Provide a precise formal specification suitable for translation into PDDL: list constants, types, predicates, and action schemas with clear preconditions and effects. Do not produce the final PDDL domain or problem; produce a structured spec that the orchestrator can convert.
spec.prompt: Your name is modeler. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->modeler->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->modeler->goal} Think step by step and produce a complete, unambiguous specification of the planning model for the 7-disk Tower of Hanoi instance.

audit.system_prompt: You are the auditor agent. Your role is to check temporal and causal consistency and to remove any bookkeeping shortcuts or implicit assumptions. Do not emit PDDL. Produce an audit report that either accepts the plan and model or provides precise corrections and justifications.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. You have the following inputs: the operator's plan {plan_operator} and the modeler's specification {model_spec}. You have the following knowledge: {agents->auditor->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->auditor->goal} Validate that every move in the plan is legal with respect to the model, that moves respect the rules (one disk at a time, only top disk moves, no larger on smaller), and that there are no unmodeled shortcuts. If issues are found, provide corrected moves or model adjustments with clear rationale.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator agent. Integrate the model specification, the operator plan, and the auditor report to produce a final PDDL domain and problem that is compatible with the FastDownward planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent-derived actions distinct and document any assumptions you had to introduce to make the specification FastDownward-ready.
pddl.prompt: There are multiple agents collaborating to solve the Tower of Hanoi task. You will receive their structured outputs. Your name is orchestrator. This is the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Here are the inputs you will receive: the operator plan {plan_operator}, the model specification {model_spec}, and the auditor report {audit_report}. Integrate these inputs, resolve naming or representation mismatches, remove any remaining bookkeeping shortcuts, and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem targeting FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions that originate from different agents logically distinct when relevant.
